en.misuse: Other gastrointestinal conditions, such as gastroesophageal (GERD), may coexist with belching disorders. Therefore, this criteria should not be the only method guiding the diagnosis and management of patients, a thorough clinical examination and physical assessment should be performed to arrive at a final diagnosis. This is especially true if the patient presents with symptoms of GI bleeding, unexplained iron deficiency anemia, unintentional weight loss, palpable abdominal mass or lymphadenopathy on exam, family history of gastric cancer and no recent upper endoscopy, dysphagia, persistent vomiting.
en.purpose: To diagnose a belching disorder based on subtype (supragastric belching vs gastric belching) using the diagnostic criteria.
en.use: The criteria should only be used in patients after appropriate organic, systemic, and metabolic causes have been ruled out after careful investigation. Patients presenting with recurrent upper gastrointestinal symptoms suggestive of a belching disorder for at least the past 6 months should be diagnosed using this criteria.
